image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu wears a suit and white shirt looking sternly

props.synopsis: The International Criminal Court's chief prosecutor says he believes Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, Defence Minister Yoav Gallant and three Hamas leaders are responsible for war crimes and crimes against humanity in the Gaza Strip and Israel.

title.children: ICC chief prosecutor seeks arrest warrants for Israeli PM and Hamas leaders over alleged war crimes

image.altText: Julian Assange looks to the camera as he is photographed from behind glass with graffiti etched into it. His grey hair is back.

props.synopsis: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange is granted leave to appeal against his extradition to the United States, after his lawyers tell a London court he would "discriminated against" in the US judicial system because he was Australian.

title.children: Assange granted last-gasp appeal in bid to avoid US extradition

image.altText: A video frame showing a woman sitting among audience members, with onscreen text.

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers stands firm on Q+A in the face of direct appeals to do more to make the property market fairer and lift people out of poverty.

title.children: Treasurer hears pleas for cost-of-living relief from constituents

image.altText: A man in a suit with a microphone.

props.synopsis: Six days after delivering his make-or-break budget, treasurer Jim Chalmers faced his own constituents in a special Q+A from Logan, south of Brisbane.

title.children: Jim Chalmers faces voters on Q+A a week after delivering budget — as it happened

image.altText: A fire breaks out next to Dumbea Mall in Koutio, Dumbea, New Caledoni

props.synopsis: Separatists in riot-hit New Caledonia refuse to abandon roadblocks that have paralysed much of the Pacific archipelago and halted commercial air traffic, defying a major security operation by French forces.

title.children: Demonstrators in riot-hit New Caledonia refuse to abandon road blocks

image.altText: A graphic of a girl with her hands behind her head, surrounded by messages saying "absolutely beautiful", "yum", "so hot".

props.synopsis: The rise of social media and child influencers has brought with it a murky underworld where men lust over kids in private chat channels and innocent images become deepfake pornography.

title.children: Adult 'fans' are subscribing for photos of an Australian child. Her parent runs the account

image.altText: The outline of four women, kept anonymous, superimposed over shattered glass

props.synopsis: A long-running inquest into the deaths of four Aboriginal women killed by their partners in the Northern Territory has heard police response times have worsened over the past 12 months.

title.children: NT domestic violence inquest hears of increasing priority-one emergency calls, lack of police

image.altText: A woman with blond hair sits outside, gazing into the distance

props.synopsis: The government is sticking by its National Plan to End Violence Against Women and Children, but a co-author of the scheme says Labor is failing to back it up with adequate investment.

title.children: 'Ambition without investment': Federal government accused of failing to invest in plan to end gendered violence

image.altText: Sir Samuel Way court building on Victoria Square

props.synopsis: Rapist Mohammad Ali Ahmad Rezaei, who "terrorised" an Adelaide woman for three years, has been jailed for more than two decades, while the victim has been praised for her "bravery and courage" in reporting his crimes to police.

title.children: Rapist jailed for two decades for 'terrorising' woman over three years

image.altText: Police in white cover-all suits stand in a passageway between units

props.synopsis: Police believe the 38-year-old had an access visit on the day and the boy's mother raised concerns when he was not returned as expected.

title.children: 'A more tragic event you wouldn't come across': Bodies of man and 2yo son found in Lismore unit

image.altText: Ali Cobby Eckermann, a 60-year-old Aboriginal woman with red hair. She is smiling at the camera, and standing in a hallway.

props.synopsis: After winning $215,000, Ali Cobby Eckermann took time off from writing. Now her new book She Is the Earth has won the top prize at the NSW Premier's Literary Awards.

title.children: Aboriginal poet wins $40,000 at major literary awards with 'profound' verse novel

image.altText: Graphic image man who is bald and has a beard surrounded by images of food

props.synopsis: Shaun Christie-David is a radical restaurateur who's employing the "unemployable" and giving away thousands of free meals.

title.children: Shaun was always ashamed of what was in his lunchbox. Now it's at the heart of his radical restaurant empire

image.altText: A man holding a hiking stick.

props.synopsis: Three Catholic high schools on the NSW Central Coast have cancelled planned visits from conservative American "chastity speaker" Jason Evert following pressure from students and parents. The schools say students can instead attend an opt-in live stream.

title.children: Schools cancel US 'chastity speaker' live events after backlash from parents, students

image.altText: A screengrab of a computer monitor displaying green bushland with a helicopter crash in the middle.

props.synopsis: The helicopter was travelling in heavy fog on the country's border with Azerbaijan when it suffered what state media described as a "hard landing".

title.children: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi and foreign minister killed in helicopter crash

image.altText: A man wearing a turban and robes holds his hands up to the camera.

props.synopsis: Iran's notorious security enforcement machine — led by the Revolutionary Guard — will be on high alert across the country following the deaths of President Ebrahim Raisi and Foreign Minister Hossein Amir Abdollahian.

title.children: In Iran, presidents come and go — the real source of the regime's power is the supreme leader

image.altText: An NRL team coach looks on and grimaces before a match.

props.synopsis: After a woeful run of results, Parramatta has fired 49-year-old Brad Arthur, who has been the Eels' coach since 2014.

title.children: Parramatta Eels sack coach Brad Arthur

image.altText: Close shot of a woman wearing a black collared shirt and red-rimmed glasses with hand on her chin

props.synopsis: After a 30-year career as an Australian food icon, Kylie Kwong announces she is closing her restaurant and quitting the business.

title.children: 'It's the right time': Chef Kylie Kwong announces end to 30-year career

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: A new ASIC report says banks aren't doing what the law says they must do to help customers in trouble, as the proportion of borrowers in strife rises due to high interest rates, rocketing rents and increases in the cost of living.

title.children: 'Overcommitment' is the top reason for mortgage hardship amid a 54 per cent spike in claims

image.altText: PROXY illustration flowers in brain

props.synopsis: Considering the rise in mental health crises in young women, a new approach is desperately needed.

title.children: Why are girls suffering so much right now? The problem is bigger than you think

image.altText: A hand holds a COVID-19 rapid antigen test. The test shows two lines, indicating a positive result.

props.synopsis: Here's what you need to know about providing evidence for sick leave when you have COVID-19.

title.children: Is a positive RAT sufficient evidence for sick leave if you have COVID?

image.altText: An eight-year-old girl with dark hair and wearing a pink cap sits on the knee of a person whose image is blurred.

props.synopsis: It is alleged a group of six men and eight women, which included her parents, prayed to God to heal eight-year-old Elizabeth Struhs, rather than seeking medical attention and held a belief that "God would heal".

title.children: Elizabeth Struhs's father baptised into religious group four months before her death, court hears

image.altText: A blonde woman with a black sparkly dress on a red carpet

props.synopsis: The actress wrote on X that the CCTV of Sean "Diddy" Combs allegedly attacking his ex-partner brought up memories of her own experience of "severe" partner abuse.

title.children: Wicked and Glee star Kristin Chenoweth reveals she is a survivor of 'severe abuse' by ex-partner

image.altText: an image of a crime scene at a KFC

props.synopsis: A court has heard a Casino teenager killed in a fatal 2022 stabbing challenged his alleged attacker, who claims self-defence, to a "one on one" multiple times.

title.children: Supreme court hears intense rivalry between teenagers resulted in fatal stabbing in KFC car park

image.altText: Supreme Court WA

props.synopsis: A jury finds a WA mother who injected her disabled daughter with insulin not guilty of attempted murder, but guilty of the alternative offence of endangering the child's life.

title.children: Mother struggling to care for 6yo daughter with cerebral palsy acquitted of attempting to murder her

image.altText: A head and shoulders shot of a smiling Brett Maston against a beige background.

props.synopsis: Police in WA arrest a convicted armed robber who had allegedly removed his electronic monitoring device.

title.children: Armed robber once dubbed Australia's most wanted apprehended after allegedly removing ankle bracelet

image.altText: The Macksville Memorial Aquatic and Fitness Centre with orange witches hats at the entrance.

props.synopsis: Police say emergency services were called to the Macksville pool on the NSW Mid North Coast to reports of children being exposed to excess fumes.

title.children: Four children rushed to hospital after exposure to fumes at public pool

image.altText: A pregnant woman works at her desk.

props.synopsis: Buried in the federal budget papers is a figure that saves the bottom line almost half a billion dollars, but instead of being a happy story it reflects a demographic freight train coming for our country.

title.children: Amid accusations of ballooning government spending, one payment is on the decline — but it's not a happy story

image.altText: A man stands with his arms crossed in front of a bus.

props.synopsis: A West Australian council is taking legal action against Danny Reinhold to stop him living in his bus, parked on a friend's block.

title.children: Council takes legal action to evict pensioner living on converted bus

image.altText: security video thumb sean combs diddy

props.synopsis: In a video on social media, the rapper apologises for the alleged assault on Cassie Ventura, in his first acknowledgement since a string of allegations against him began.

title.children: Diddy apologises and takes 'full responsibility' for CCTV video showing assault of ex

image.altText: A cat sits on the wall of a university building.

props.synopsis: The feline was honoured for his friendliness on campus ahead of student graduations.

title.children: Max the cat earns degree in 'litter-ature' at US university

image.altText: A young mother with holding an infant and painting with her toddler daughter outside with a pool in the background.

props.synopsis: There has been a 195 per cent increase in home school registrations in Queensland in the past five years, and this Rockhampton mother is opening her own Steiner school after seeking non-mainstream options for her daughters.

title.children: Within days of announcing the Steiner school's opening, 110 families expressed interest. Why is it popular?

image.altText: A woman looking at an old mobile phone device

props.synopsis: Lauren Trevan works for Queensland charity, DV Safe Phone, which repurposes old mobile phones and donates them to those experiencing digital abuse in the form of stalking and control through their existing devices.

title.children: Charity repurposing old phones to help free domestic violence victims from rising digital abuse

image.altText: A large bee with black and blue stripes.

props.synopsis: Flowers, honey and plenty of produce: bees play a vital role in nature's ecosystem, and without them, we wouldn't have any of these things.

title.children: How to spot a native bee and what to do to help bolster populations. Here's what you need to know
